title: Ice samples from Greenland, Russia provide clues to past, future climate change
content: Scientists have discovered evidence of carbonaceous aerosols -- organic dust -- transported from Asia and deposited in the Arctic over the last 450 years, according to a study. They have also found that increased levels of dust were being deposited during warmer periods when the Arctic Oscillation -- changes in the prevailing wind direction centred on the Atlantic -- was at its strongest.
